TopicTitle: Attack on Munar City and more!

Articles.Content:
Attack on Munar City. Picture taken May 2018. Kinda late but has a good backstory.

The KSC has a plan to start a network of landed crafts with different modules to cooperate with each other. Hence why there are so many markers all over the ground. Munar City is much less a city and more like scattered crafts with mining and docking modules and the farthest crafts from the epicenter of the landed modules are about 1.5km out.

Badguy Kerman is a kerbal I made up who is the primary antagonist of Munar City, he apparently hates the KSC and their mission of colonising the Kerbol system and has launched his own craft with a fairing on top containing a missile launcher with two missiles. (Horrible way to attack 10 meter tall and 2 meter wide landed crafts from more than 3 kilometers away if you ask me) Badguy's flawed attack plan on Munar City 

So the missiles were launched at Munar City and landed about 150 meters from an SSTO that was rotating members of Munar City to launch to Minmus and Jebediah Kerman spotted the missiles while climbing a ladder into the SSTO and followed the missiles back to their origin, using up a large portion of his EVA pack. He found the missile launcher. Badguy Kerman was about 200 meters away and jetpacked to his nearby lander and took off. His missile turret launcher also doubled as a mining station and was refueling the lander the whole time. Jebediah reported to the KSC about the whereabouts of Badguy Kerman and found he was going to Jool. Our cliche hero Jeb proceeds to take off with his SSTO and get back to Kerbin to get a craft designed to get to Jool with a mini jail cell in it. Badguy arrives at Jool and heads to Vall, but crash lands. He is stranded on Vall and proceeds to wait out his time until Jeb arrives and captures him. 

I hope you enjoyed this extremely drawn out story and despite it being old, and a bit late for sharing I figured it was still worth sharing. Also I was a lot worse at KSP back then and used infinite fuel to get places. (This was about 4 months after I started playing the game).
Hmmm... mission report or work of a fan? Sounds like a mission report. And so, thread moved.
